contentrichtext.text: '''Tsesungún''' is a dialect of [[Huilliche]], an [[Araucanian]] language spoken in [[Chile]]. Most of its speakers speak [[Spanish language|Spanish]] as their first language. It is closely related but barely intelligible to [[Mapudungun]] speakers. It is classified as [[Araucanian]]/Huilliche/Tsesungun. It is used mostly in mountain valleys for ceremonial purposes. ==External links== * [http://www.ethnologue.com/show_language.asp?code=huh Ethnologue.com entry for Huilliche] {{Mapuche}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tsesungun Dialect}} [[Category:Languages of Chile]] [[Category:Mapudungun]] [[es:Chesungun]]
